1.name: Aberration Hunters' Amulet
1.description: The Aberration Hunters' Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that grants a Githyanki wearing it Advantage on Intelligence Saving Throws and aberrations have Disadvantage on attacks against them. The wielder can gain Advantage on Attack Rolls against Aberrations for 3 turns, once per Short Rest.
1.quote: Many a Githyanki hunter has worn this amulet before you. The strange stones set in swirling silver reverberate with echoes of their magic.

1.name: Absolute Confidence Amulet
1.description: The Absolute Confidence Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer a +1 bonus to Performance checks at the cost of -1 to Intimidation checks.
1.quote: The interlocked bronze links of this necklace tinkle softly every time you move.

1.name: Absolute's Talisman
1.description: Absolute's Talisman is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast a self-only version of Aid, and grants Advantage on Death Saving Throws if they bear the Absolute's Brand.
1.quote: Stained by blood, and gifted only to the most faithful of True Souls to help preserve their lives.

1.name: Amulet of Bhaal
1.description: Amulet of Bhaal is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to inflict Bleeding when hitting targets with maximum hit points.
1.quote: A silver amulet depicting the symbol of Bhaal.

1.name: Amulet of Branding
1.description: The Amulet of Branding is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Brand the Weak once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Though thin and delicate looking, the amulet's pendant sits heavy against your chest.

1.name: Amulet of Elemental Torment
1.description: The Amulet of Elemental Torment is an uncommon Surfaces into the wearer's spells.
1.quote: Each jewel gleams with the energy of the natural elements.

1.name: Amulet of Greater Health
1.description: Amulet of Greater Health is a very rare Amulet that can be obtained from the House of Hope.
1.quote: Worn by Lumi, a cleric beholden to twilight, who sheltered her fellow adventurers as a bantam shelters her chicks.

1.name: Amulet of Misty Step
1.description: Amulet of Misty Step is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Misty Step Icon Misty Step once per Short Rest.
1.quote: Made of blue gems unique to a privately-owned mine in Menzoberranzan, this necklace was likely a token of esteem - or perhaps a desperate attempt to win its recipient's mercy.

1.name: Amulet of Restoration
1.description: Amulet of Restoration is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Healing Word and Mass Healing Word once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The gemstone centrepiece of the amulet was long ago mottled and dyed by the tears of a martyr.

1.name: Amulet of Selûne's Chosen
1.description: The Amulet of Selûne's Chosen is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Selûne's Dream once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The gems and pearls of this necklace have a brilliant shine to them, as if reflecting unseen moonlight.

1.name: Amulet of Silvanus
1.description: The Amulet of Silvanus is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Lesser Restoration once per Long Rest.
1.quote: This amulet, engraved with a small waterfall, imparts a feeling of calm serenity when worn.

1.name: Amulet of the Devout
1.description: The Amulet of the Devout is a very rare Amulet that grants the wearer a +2 bonus to Spell Save DC and, if the wearer has access to it, an additional use of Channel_Divinity_Charges_Icons|Channel Divinity.
1.quote: Otto, a member of the powerful arcane organisation the Circle of Eight, had a penchant for amulets. So much so that they announced his arrival before he ever needed to.

1.name: Amulet of the Drunkard
1.description: Amulet of the Drunkard is a rare Amulet that causes the wearer to regain Healing|2d8 hit points per turn while Drunk. It also increases the duration of inebriation by 5 turns.
1.quote: Donning this necklace causes the room to sway and tip - or maybe it was already swaying? Whatever, time for another pint.

1.name: Amulet of the Harpers
1.description: Amulet of the Harpers is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Saving Throws.
1.quote: Nobility can be found in suffering the slings and arrows of outrageous fortune. So can dying. Best to be on guard.

1.name: Amulet of the Unworthy
1.description: The Amulet of the Unworthy is an uncommon Amulet that protects the wearer from Slashing damage, but leaves them vulnerable to Bludgeoning damage.
1.quote: Once part of the Girdle of Blades, this buckle was torn off and fashioned into an amulet that can be worn by creatures of all sizes.

1.name: Amulet of Windrider
1.description: Amulet of Windrider is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Ride the Wind and Gust of Wind. It is one of the rewards of the quest Save Vanra.
1.quote: Heavily embossed with filigree, this necklace reflects light in all directions.

1.name: Beastmaster's Chain
1.description: Beastmaster's Chain is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Animal Friendship once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The green jewel set into this necklace's pendant is carved to resemble a cat's slivered pupil.

1.name: Bloody Amulet
1.description: Bloody Amulet is an Amulet and a Story Item.
1.quote: Tiny specks of blood cover this amulet. They have pooled into the engravings on the back, spelling out the name 'Wulbren' in a grisly brown hue.

1.name: Brass Locket
1.description: Brass Locket is an Amulet and a Story Item.
1.quote: Slightly tarnished, and opened with a mere flick of the thumb.

1.name: Bronze Necklace
1.description: A Bronze Necklace is a common Amulet that's primary purpose is to sell for gold.
1.quote: Though shining brilliantly, this necklace smells distinctively of rust.

1.name: Broodmother's Revenge
1.description: The Broodmother's Revenge is an uncommon Amulet that coats the wearer's weapon in poison whenever they are healed.
1.quote: Each of this amulet's jewels shines like a viper's eyes.

1.name: Burnished Necklace
1.description: Burnished Necklaces are unenchanted Amulets found as random loot.
1.quote: Bright and polished, this necklace was clearly cherished by its previous owner.

1.name: Champion's Chain
1.description: Champion's Chain is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to grant an ally a bonus to Intimidation.
1.quote: A plump mass torn from Sovereign Glut's own flesh. A marker of the colony's esteem - or perhaps its property.

1.name: Corvid Token
1.description: Corvid Token is a very rare Amulet that increases flying speed, grants the Feather Fall while Polymorphed or Wild Shaped.
1.quote: 'Let your lips turn black as night/On this eve of frightful wights/Let your throat be filled with screams/Nearby looms the Raven Queen!' - A song of dark festivity

1.name: Dog Collar
1.description: Dog Collar is a common Amulet. Primarily of use for barter or sale to Traders.
1.quote: An old, leather collar for a large dog. The name 'Myrna' is engraved on the tag, surrounded by a plethora of indecipherable runes.

1.name: Envoy's Amulet
1.description: Envoy's Amulet is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to grant an ally a bonus to Persuasion.
1.quote: A fleshy amulet shaped by Sovereign Spaw's own hand. Wherever the bearer goes, so does the myconid circle.

1.name: Fey Semblance Amulet
1.description: Fey Semblance Amulet is a very rare Amulet that gives the user advantage on all mental saving throws.
1.quote: Originally the kidney stone of an archfey, this object has been ahem, passed down through the centuries.

1.name: Fireheart
1.description: Fireheart is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer 2 turns of Heat when they take Fire|Fire damage.
1.quote: The ruby's red reflections look like eerie flames dancing across your skin.

1.name: Frost Prince
1.description: Frost Prince is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer the ability to cast the Ice Knife spell.
1.quote: Each sapphire feels like a tiny shard of sharpened ice.

1.name: Gold Necklace
1.description: A Gold Necklace is a common Amulet. Primarily of use for barter or sale to Traders.
1.quote: Tiny, ageless flower petals fill the amber stones of this necklace.

1.name: Hammergrim Mist Amulet
1.description: The Hammergrim Mist Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer the ability to cast the Fog Cloud spell.
1.quote: One of the relics of Deep Duerra's rebellious children. Drugging the Keykeeper of Duerra's vaults, the children crept in under cover of night and plundered their mother's treasure - searching desperately for anything that would aid in their flight.

1.name: Ilmater's Aid
1.quote: Named for the god of the Martyrs, this amulet seems to shine in the presence of the wearer's blood.

1.name: Khalid's Gift
1.description: Khalid's Gift is a very rare Amulet that was gifted to Jaheira by Khalid and stored away in the basement of her home. While wearing it, Jaheira cannot be cursed.
1.quote: A gift from Khalid for Jaheira.

1.name: Komira's Locket
1.description: Komira's Locket is an uncommon Amulet that grants the wearer the ability to cast the Dancing Lights cantrip.
1.quote: Worked carefully into the locket's metal back are the words, 'Never dark again.'

1.name: Magic Amulet
1.description: Magic Amulet is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to use a reaction to make an Attack Roll or SavingThrow with Advantage, once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Imbued with a little luck after the item was pressed to the pursed lips of a saint of the goddess Tymora.

1.name: Mayrina's Locket
1.description: Mayrina's Locket is an Amulet and a Story Item.
1.quote: An aged, blue-stained scrap of paper within this locket reads: 'To Mayrina - Will you go to the summer fair with me? From Connor. PS. These bluebells are from Ma Grundy's patch, please don't tell!'

1.name: Moondrop Pendant
1.description: The Moondrop Pendant is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to avoid provoking Attacks of Opportunity when below 50% hit points.
1.quote: The back bears an inscription under a delicate crescent moon. 'You're a novice no more, Robin. Only right you should carry a little of our Lady's light with you.'

1.name: Necklace of Elemental Augmentation
1.description: Necklace of Elemental Augmentation is an uncommon Amulet that adds the Spellcasting Modifier to the damage when the wearer uses elemental damage with a cantrip.
1.quote: The tourmaline in this necklace is almost uncomfortably hot, warmed by a heat all its own.

1.name: Pearl of Power Amulet
1.description: The Pearl of Power Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wielder to restore a spell slot of 3rd level or lower.
1.quote: There are no molluscs of power, alas.

1.name: Periapt of Wound Closure
1.description: Periapt of Wound Closure is a rare Amulet that automatically stabilizes a downed user at the start of their turn and maximizes the amount of hit points.
1.quote: Sometimes the best thing you can do for your friend is to stop bleeding and give them a chance to sort everything out.

1.name: Psychic Spark
1.description: Psychic Spark is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast a stronger version of Magic Missile.
1.quote: Every gem hanging from this necklace is warm to the touch, as if waiting to ignite.

1.name: Sentient Amulet (Rare)
1.description: Sentient Amulet is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Shatter once per Ki Restoration (Lesser)}} once per [[Long Rest.
1.quote: Sun-graced warmth radiates from both the pendant and its chain. Somehow, even a brief glance of it brings a smile to your face.

1.name: Sentient Amulet (Very Rare)
1.description: Sentient Amulet is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Shatter once per Ki Restoration (Greater)}} once per Long Rest. It is a possible reward for the quest [[Help the Cursed Monk.
1.quote: Sun-graced warmth radiates from both the pendant and its chain. Somehow, even a brief glance of it brings a smile to your face.

1.name: Shar's Temptation
1.description: Shar's Temptation is an Amulet that allows its wearer to cast Charm Person once per Short Rest.
1.quote: The inlaid jewels are so rich in colour, so deep in hue, you could lose yourself in them.

1.name: Silver Locket
1.description: Silver Locket is a common Amulet. It has no enchantments.
1.quote: A finely crafted silver locket, engraved with the words 'For Papa.'

1.name: Silver Necklace
1.description: A Silver Necklace is a common Amulet that's primary purpose is to sell for gold.
1.quote: Sapphire necklaces are popular among Baldur's Gate's patriars as mourning garb - the heavy teardrop-shaped stones represent the weight of their loss.

1.name: Silver Pendant
1.description: The Silver Pendant is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Guidance.
1.quote: Grime covers this necklace, but you can vaguely discern delicate engravings of a moon and harp.

1.name: Spell Savant Amulet
1.description: Spell Savant Amulet is a rare Amulet that grants an additional Level 2 spell slot.
1.quote: When on the wrong side of a few sherries, the powerful wizards Bigby and Tenser would sometimes see how many spells they could fit into amulets like this one before they burst.

1.name: Spellcrux Amulet
1.description: Spellcrux Amulet is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to restore any one spell slot once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Some scholars have speculated that spells have a mind of their own, suggesting that the spells get bored between being cast and restored.

1.name: Spineshudder Amulet
1.description: Spineshudder Amulet is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to inflict Reverberation when dealing damage with ranged spell attacks.
1.quote: Quivers creep up your enemy's back - the slow, long-fingered hand of your magic.

1.name: Strange Tendril Amulet
1.description: Strange Tendril Amulet is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Evard's Black Tentacles once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Eldritch sigils seem to course through the metalwork on this amulet

1.name: Surgeon's Subjugation Amulet
1.description: The Surgeon's Subjugation Amulet is a rare Amulet that, once per Long Rest, paralyses a humanoid on a Critical Hit.
1.quote: A surgeon is only as reliable as her tools. And, indeed, as depraved.

1.name: Tarnished Charm
1.description: The Tarnished Charm is an uncommon Amulet that aids the wearer with Death Saving Throws. nograd=1
1.quote: A menacing cackle emanates from this twisted charm. It whispers to bite, to maim, to kill...

1.name: Tarnished Locket
1.description: Tarnished Locket is a common Amulet without any enchantments.
1.quote: This locket opens to reveal an intricate illustration of a stone tower. The words 'Elturel: Strength in Unity' are inscribed across the top.

1.name: The Amulet of Lost Voices
1.description: The Amulet of Lost Voices is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Speak with Dead once per Long Rest.
1.quote: The dead hold no secrets from Jergal's Scriveners of Doom.

1.name: The Blast Pendant
1.description: The Blast Pendant is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to focus and discharge their Lightning Charges to strengthen their next lightning spell.
1.quote: Though they only worked together for a short time, it is hard to overstate the influence Lenore the cleric of Mystra had on Yrre the Sparkstruck, who often likened harnessing lightning to manipulating the Weave.

1.name: The Ever-Seeing Eye
1.description: The Ever-Seeing Eye is an uncommon Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Protection from Evil and Good once per Short Rest.
1.quote: A pale, green eye, pierced by the twisting branches of a dead tree - the result of a foolhardy woman begging Auntie for a favour.

1.name: The Spectator Eyes
1.description: The Spectator Eyes is a very rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Ray of Fear and Wounding Ray once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Spectators are hideous aberrations that float above the ground, fiercely staring around and shooting beams at anything they don't appreciate.

1.name: Uncovered Mysteries
1.description: Uncovered Mysteries is a rare Amulet that allows the wearer to cast Detect Thoughts once per Long Rest.
1.quote: Beneath the layers of dust covering this necklace, its inlaid gems still give off a blue sparkle - the colour of Mystra's clergy.

1.name: Unflinching Protector Amulet
1.description: Unflinching Protector Amulet is a very rare Amulet that can be obtained from Ptaris.
1.quote: Touching this amulet's centerpiece, you are imbued with a vision of woven strands, and the strands coming apart and holding true and firm over your friends, like shields banded in a haze of golden light.

2.name: Plain Boots
2.description: Plain Boots are a common footwear.
2.quote: These boots are well-maintained and clean, though their soles are thin from wear.

3.name: Cape of the Red Prince
3.quote: A noble warrior's cloak, woven in the heart of an ancient empire.

3.name: Cindermoth Cloak
3.description: Cindermoth Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that inflicts Burning on any foe within 2m / 7ft that damages the wearer.
3.quote: With every rustle of this cloak, small moths like windblown embers appear around you - they flutter for a moment, then fade into inconsequence.

3.name: Cloak of Cunning Brume
3.description: Cloak of Cunning Brume is an uncommon Cloak that grants the user a smokescreen cloud effect when trying to Disengage.
3.quote: One of the relics of Deep Durrea's rebellious children. The children found nothing of use in the vault and were discouraged. But in the morning the Vault Keykeeper's son, who admired the children, sought them out - and in his arms he brought a wealth of things, forged in shadow.

3.name: Cloak of Displacement
3.description: Cloak of Displacement is a rare Cloak that, every turn, subjects enemy attacks against its wearer to Disadvantage until the wearer takes damage.
3.quote: The fur is so blue as to be almost black. When mantled across your shoulders, the patterns on the cloak seem to shift and ripple.

3.name: Cloak of Elemental Absorption
3.description: Cloak of Elemental Absorbtion is an uncommon Cloak that allows the wearer to absorb a small amount of magical damage, and add it to their next attack.
3.quote: A favourite among flee-footed gish, this cloak allows the wearer to wield a foe's elemental mastery against them.

3.name: Cloak of Protection
3.description: Cloak of Protection is an uncommon Cloak that grants the user +1 Armour Class and +1 to SavingThrows

3.name: Cloak of the Weave
3.description: Cloak of the Weave is a very rare Cloak that allows the wearer to absorb a small amount of magical damage, and add it to their next attack. It also gives better Spell Save DC and Spell Attack Rolls.
3.quote: Part of an outfit worn by the wizard Tenser when he was inducted into the organization of eminent wizards called the Circle of Eight.

3.name: Derivation Cloak
3.description: Derivation Cloak is a rare Cloak that heals the wearer for 1d4 Poison a foe.
3.quote: Based on a mad alchemist's experiments to derive youth from his victims by poisoning them, this cloak relies on a much more reliable arcane formula.

3.name: Fleshmelter Cloak
3.description: Fleshmelter Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that deals acid damage to creatures that deal melee damage to the wearer.
3.quote: Droplets of foul acid drip from the tails of this cloak, as if from the stinger of a demonic scorpion.

3.name: Mantle of the Holy Warrior
3.description: The Mantle of the Holy Warrior is a Very Rare Cloak that grants the wearer the ability to cast Crusader's Mantle.
3.quote: This garment accidentally fell into the communal steambaths during the All Saints Retreat and Candlelit Guided Meditation.

3.name: Nymph Cloak
3.description: Nymph Cloak is a very rare Cloak that allows the wearer to cast Dominate Person once per Long Rest.
3.quote: The charmers, seducers, philanderers, flirts, gallants, beguilers, ravishers, rogues, tempters, and tantalisers of the Feywild all share one common trait: they make you feel as if you are the only diamond among the drift.

3.name: Reverse Rain Cloak
3.description: Reverse Rain Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that grants the user condition wet while worn.
3.quote: The wearer is perpetually just a little bit damp.

3.name: Shade-Slayer Cloak
3.description: Shade-Slayer Cloak is a very rare Cloak that reduces the number you need to roll a hiding.
3.quote: Rough and coarse, the cloak's materials soften to solk when immersed in shadow.

3.name: The Deathstalker Mantle
3.description: The Deathstalker Mantle is a rare Invisible for 2 turns after killing an enemy.
3.quote: Let hill and hollow be a doorTo screams that last forevermore

3.name: Thunderskin Cloak
3.description: Thunderskin Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that has a chance to Daze creatures with the Reverberation condition when they damage to the wearer.
3.quote: Through a gap in the long snarls of thread, you are sure you can glimpse a great black thunderhead swollen with purple lightning and spears of rain.

3.name: Vivacious Cloak
3.description: Vivacious Cloak is an uncommon Cloak that grants the wearer 7 temporary Hit Points when casting a spell in melee.
3.quote: The sheer mortal terror of the low-vitality spellcaster (who can be blown over by a wafted spoon) can be partially offset by cloaks like this one.

3.name: Wavemother's Cloak
3.description: Wavemother's Cloak is a rare Cloak that grants its wearer Water Layer Protection every turn.
3.quote: Little jellyfish-shaped pockets line the inside of this cloak.

4.name: Armour of Uninhibited Kushigo
4.description: The Armour of Uninhibited Kushigo is an uncommon piece of Clothing that grants the wearer Mage Armour Icon Kushigo Counter.
4.quote: Long ago, Kushigo was a warrior. Bedecked in an enormous set of plate steel, its shoulder pauldrons fashioned like great antlered stags, his arrival on a battlefield spelled doom for the enemy.Yet this armour - so light and fine - speaks nothing to that legacy.

4.name: Barbarian Clothes
4.description: Barbarian Clothes are a common piece of Clothing.
4.quote: A rough combination of furs, leathers, and supple fabrics, made for a life outside civilisation.

4.name: Bided Time
4.description: Bided Time is a set of uncommon Clothing that causes the wearer to gain Arcane Charge Condition Icon|Arcane Charge (Condition)|Arcane Charge whenever they are hit by a melee attack.
4.quote: Revenge is best served. Hot or cold makes no difference.

4.name: Bloodguzzler Garb
4.description: The Bloodguzzler Garb is a rare piece of Wrath when an enemy damages the wearer.
4.quote: No sooner does blood speck the armour than it's absorbed, as if sustaining something within.

4.name: Bonespike Garb
4.description: Bonespike Garb is a very rare Clothing that grants temporary hit points when using Rage.
4.quote: Sharp juts and knobbly nodules of bone stud this armour, as if something ancient sank its teeth deep into the leather and they got stuck there.

4.name: Cloth of Authority
4.description: Cloth of Authority is a rare piece of Clothing that grants immunity to emotion-altering conditions and grants +1 Armour Class and Advantage on Intimidation and Insight checks.
4.quote: One can hardly be called a lord if they aren't dressed as such. A cursory glance at Gortash's finery would reveal intricate garb - a closer look would reveal a maddening attention to even the most minute details of the filigree.

4.name: Drunken Cloth
4.description: Drunken Cloth is a rare piece of Clothing.
4.quote: Long ago, Kushigo was a warrior. Bedecked in enormous, stag-antlered plate, his arrival spelled doom for the enemy. This flimsy cloth speaks nothing to that legacy.

4.name: Enraging Heart Garb
4.description: The Enraging Heart Garb is a rare piece of Wrath while the wearer is Raging.
4.quote: Created by a designer and an enchanter who were going through a messy divorce at the time. As such the armour is filled with passive-aggresive rage.

4.name: Garb of the Land and Sky
4.description: Garb of the Land and Sky is rare Force|1d8 Force}} damage. It also grants +1 [[Armour Class.
4.quote: Long ago, Kushigo was a warrior. Bedecked in an enormous set of plate steel, its shoulder pauldrons fashioned like great antlered stags, his arrival on a battlefield spelled doom for the enemy.Yet this armour - so light and fine - speaks nothing to the legacy.

4.name: Icebite Robe
4.description: Icebite Robe is a rare piece of Resistance to Cold|Cold damage and allows them to cast Armour of Agathys as a 3rd level spell once per Long Rest.
4.quote: Delicate ferns of frost glitter in the lining of this robe.

4.name: Infernal Robe
4.description: The Infernal Robe is a very rare piece of clothing that grant Resistance to Fire damage and the ability to cast the Fire-damage version of Fire Shield.
4.quote: Presumably Mizora was not always a sensuous and manipulative benefactor of troubled souls like Wyll. Negotiating the hierarchies of hell result in changes of form - but was she ever less beautiful, less erudite, less willful?

4.name: Monastic Robes
4.description: Monastic Robes are a common piece of Clothing.
4.quote: This garment's pristine condition despite years of martial training speaks to a supremely disciplined owner.

4.name: Moon Devotion Robe
4.description: Moon Devotion Robe is a very rare Clothing.
4.quote: A memory from her childhood: a warm bed. Through the cracked window, she could see the moonlight cupping the plums in the tree as if in silver hands. The name of the goddess Selûne came to her, and never left.

4.name: Obsidian Laced Robe
4.description: Obsidian Laced Robe is rare Fire|5~8}} damage to enemies on a successful [[Saving Throw against their spells. Also grants Resistance to Fire|Fire damage.
4.quote: The inside of this robe is dark and faceted like volcanic glass, yet the material is light and soft. Against the skin, it also produces a heat like a toasty fire on a day of snow.

4.name: Poisoner's Robe
4.description: The Poisoner's Robe is an uncommon piece of Clothing that makes the wearer's poison spells deal more damage.
4.quote: Found in the Spider Queen's stomach, this robe emanates a sour smell and stings to the touch.

4.name: Potent Robe
4.description: The Potent Robe is a very rare piece of clothing that uses your Charisma modifier to increase your cantrips' damage as well as give you temporary hit points.
4.quote: This robe is a difficult look to pull off unless one is blessed with an otherwordly charisma.

4.name: Robe of Exquisite Focus
4.description: The Robe of Exquisite Focus is a rare piece of Clothing that increase its wearer's Spell Save DC.
4.quote: This robe once belonged to one of the great Wizard Tenser's lecturers. While in university, Tenser used to practice spells on this robe, sometimes resulting in wonderful arcane discovery.

4.name: Robe of Summer
4.description: The Robe of Summer is an uncommon piece of Resistance to Cold|Cold damage.
4.quote: This robe's thin fabric is pleasantly warm to the touch.

4.name: Robe of Supreme Defences
4.description: The Robe of Supreme Defences is a very rare Clothing that boosts your defences, when you are concentrating on a spell.
4.quote: Long ago, the young wizard Bigby noticed his friend Tenser spending a lot of time with his robe. One of nature's pranksters Bigby sent his dog, Bigboy, to savage the garnment. The ensuing struggle between canine and nude wizard was brutal, and eventually lead to Tenser designing more durable robes like this one.

4.name: Robe of the Weave
4.description: Robe of the Weave is a very rare Clothing that allows the wearer to heal when succeeding a saving throw against a spell.
4.quote: Earnest little Edith Cluckle was a small girl when she asked to be the great wizard Otiluke's apprentice. He scoffed at her, but was quickly abashed when Mystra herself endowed Edith with this very cloak.

4.name: Shelter of Athkatla
4.description: Shelter of Athkatla is a rare Clothing looted from Lorroakan.
4.quote: Mantled in the sublime majesty of this cloak, you magically sense Lorroakan's complex feelings for his homeland. Merriment and comfort go hand in hand with a jilted sentiment around his lovers and his family. And the old friends he thought of, but would never see again.

4.name: Simple Robe
4.description: A Simple Robe is a common piece of Clothing.
4.quote: Crafted with care, this robe will protect you from the elements. It won't do much against a sword's thrust, though.

4.name: Sorcerer Robe
4.description: The Sorcerer Robe is a common piece of Clothing.
4.quote: Neat leather bands keep the trailing cloth secure. Singed sleeves are a liability for any spellcaster.

4.name: The Graceful Cloth
4.description: The Graceful Cloth is a rare piece of Clothing that gives its wearer +2 Dexterity.
4.quote: A garment worn by one of three monks who fought together against Headless Serpent, Secret Venom, a gang in the port city of Nyanzaru. This was worn by Roahton Mobar, whose stances were broad and strong.

4.name: The Mighty Cloth
4.description: The Mighty Cloth is a rare piece of Clothing that gives its wearer +2 Strength.
4.quote: A garment worn by one of three monks who fought together against Headless Serpent, Secret Venom, a gang in the port city of Nyanzaru. This was worn by Kimigha Poji, whose stances were narrow and swift.

4.name: The Protecty Sparkswall
4.description: The Protecty Sparkswall is an rare Clothing that buffs the wearer's defences while they have Lightning Charges.
4.quote: Yrre the Sparkstruck was raised in the Underdark, and so they weren't surprised that power begets envy, and envy begets violence. They were prepared.

4.name: Veil of the Morning
4.description: Veil of the Morning is a very rare Clothing that imposes Disadvantage on Undead Attack Rolls against the wearer, grants the wearer Advantage against Undead spells and actions, and allows the wearer to Turn Undead.
4.quote: Crafted from celestial feathers, bottled sunlight, and ink from the pages of sacred scripture, it's a wonder the maker didn't hang cloves of garlic from this robe, so anathema is it to the undead.

4.name: Vest of Soul Rejuvenation
4.description: Vest of Soul Rejuvenation is a very rare Clothing that allows the wearer to heal on a successful saving throw against a spell, among other bonuses.
4.quote: A garment worn by one of three monks who fought together against Headless Serpent, Secret Venom, a gang in the port city of Nyanzaru. This was worn by Strigga Morkoscavich, whose stances moved fluidly, flawlessly and who defanged the Serpent one blustery night.

4.name: Viconia's Priestess Robe
4.description: Viconia's Priestess Robe is a robe worn by the Sharan Priestess Viconia
4.quote: Listening to the magical hum this robe emits dulls your senses, thoughts, feelings - everything. Listen too long, and you can almost hear the screaming chitters of a thousand spiders devoured by encroaching, hungry darkness. Almost.

4.name: Wavemother's Robe
4.description: Wavemother's Robe is a very rare Clothing obtained from siding with the Temple of Umberlee during Chapter Three.
4.quote: Tales tell of a most wonderous fish, scales resplendent, an intricate jewel that shone beneath the sea. When it died, the Wavemother gifted its hide as a robe to her most devoted follower - and demanded she drown the sailors that kill her gem-bright fish.

6.name: Adamantine Splint Armour
6.description: Adamantine Splint Armour is a very rare Heavy Armour that sends attackers Reeling.
6.quote: The adamantine plates lock and slide together perfectly - offering protection against even the deadliest of blades.

6.name: Armour of Devotion
6.description: Armour of Devotion is a set of rare Full Plate Heavy Armour that allows the wearer to cast Eternal Devotion, restoring a charge of their Paladin Channel Oath ability.
6.quote: The soft hum of a fervent prayer reverberates throughout the armoured plates.

6.name: Armour of Persistence
6.description: Armour of Persistence is a very rare Armour that grants its wearer permanent Resistance and Blade Ward effects in addition to reducing all damage taken by 2.
6.quote: Great sheets of steel were hammered and bashed into something like a carapace, thick and dense - you can almost feel the hammer blows, flooded with rich magic.

6.name: Blackguard's Plate
6.description: Blackguard's Plate is a very rare Heavy Armour.
6.quote: To break one's oath is a dangerous game - it marks you as a faithless cur, an exile without a cause. The armour is tempered by an age of rocks, blades, and persecution turned against it - and is buffed by the immutable, unbindable will of its wearer.

6.name: Cerebral Citadel Armour
6.description: Cerebral Citadel Armour is a rare Heavy Armour that makes the wearer immune to being Frightened and gives a +1 bonus to all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws if the wearer is infested by a mind flayer tadpole.
6.quote: The little tentacle engravings are a nice touch.

6.name: Chain Mail
6.description: Chain Mail is a common Heavy Armour.
6.quote: The tight weave of chains in this armour chimes like wind through leaves.

6.name: Chain Mail +1
6.description: Chain Mail +1 is an uncommon Heavy Armour.
6.quote: Fine fabric obscures the bulk of this chain mail, allowing its wearer to mix in polite society while protecting them from unexpected assailants.

6.name: Chain Mail +2
6.description: Chain Mail +2 is a rare Heavy Armour.
6.quote: Made from thick, strong chains loosely-fitted, this armour hangs more heavily than some but protects its wearer with an impenetrable weave of metal.

6.name: Dwarven Splintmail
6.description: Dwarven Splintmail is a rare Heavy Armour.
6.quote: Skilled hands crafted this armour, reinforcing the metal plates while sacrificing none of the flexibility.

6.name: Emblazoned Plate of the Marshal
6.description: Emblazoned Plate of the Marshal is a very rare Heavy Armor that provides the wearer damage reduction, Fire Resistance, and the ability to cast Spell Evocation FireShield|Fire Shield|size=25.
6.quote: The tabard adoring this perfectly-kept platemail denotes the status of its wearer - Marshal of the Flaming Fist and ultimate military authority in Baldur's Gate.

6.name: Flawed Helldusk Armour
6.description: Flawed Helldusk Armour is a rare Heavy Armour.
6.quote: 'I learned so much from Carixim. All sorts of forgecraft that... S-sorry. Just when I think of him, and the whimpers those people inside him made... I don't know. Anyway, it was worth it. Worth it to be the best.' - Overheard from the smith Dammon

6.name: Helldusk Armour
6.description: Helldusk Armour is a legendary heavy Armour that can be obtained from Raphael during Chapter Three.
6.quote: Carixim, soul-stuffed forgemaster of hellish Avernus, hammers away ceaselessly at new creations. Questions of morality and destiny do not concern him. Conscience is for his betters. He works with cheer, his swollen skin moaning soothingly.

6.name: Plate Armour
6.description: Plate Armour is a common Heavy Armour.

6.name: Plate Armour +1
6.description: Plate Armour +1 is an uncommon Heavy Armour.

6.name: Plate Armour +2
6.description: Plate Armour +2 is a rare Heavy Armour.

6.name: Protective Plate
6.description: Protective Plate is a set of Heavy Resistance to Necrotic damage.

6.name: Reaper's Embrace
6.description: Reaper's Embrace is a very rare heavy Armour that can be obtained from Ketheric Thorm.
6.quote: Heavy steel bones and teeth enclose the armour's chest and neck like a grotesque exoskeleton that both swallows and protects the wearer.

6.name: Ring Mail Armour
6.description: Ring Mail Armour is a common Heavy Armour.

6.name: Ring Mail Armour +1
6.description: Ring Mail Armour +1 is a uncommon Heavy Armour.

6.name: Ring Mail Armour +2
6.description: Ring Mail Armour +2 is a rare Heavy Armour.

6.name: Rippling Force Mail
6.description: Rippling Force Mail is a rare Heavy Armour that reduces physical damage taken and causes its wearer to deal force damage around them after being struck with physical attacks enough times.
6.quote: Dents, notches, and nicks add character to each ring of this mail - yet each blemish also speaks to those who tasted magical vengeance on the armour's behalf.

6.name: Splint Armour
6.description: Splint Armour is a common Heavy Armour.
6.quote: Combining sturdy metal plates with flexible cloth, this armour promises protection and mobility.

6.name: Splint Armour +1
6.description: Splint Armour +1 is a uncommon Heavy Armour.
6.quote: Skilled hands crafted this armour, reinforcing the metal plates while sacrificing none of the flexibility.

6.name: Splint Armour +2
6.description: Splint Armour +2 is a rare Heavy Armour.
6.quote: Wrought of an artisan's skill and passion, this armour will turn aside all but the fiercest of blades.

7.name: Adjustable Steel Helm
7.quote: Grated and fixable, so the wearer might gulp cool air during a fight.

7.name: Assassin of Bhaal Cowl
7.quote: When he was killed, Bhaal's blight upon the world was not destroyed. For the many people upon whom he had sired his spawn slithered out of tainted wombs, and with their arrival Bhaal's malcontent returned with force.

7.name: Bicorne of the Sea Beast
7.quote: A battered two-point hat that's seen the wear and tear of rebellion.

7.name: Birthright
7.description: Birthright is a very rare Headwear that gives the wearer Charisma +2, up to a maximum of 22.
7.quote: 'The thing that you poor sods simply cannot grasp is how effortless all this magical hootie-wootie castie-spellsie business is for me!’ - A very stupid sorcerer at a wizard academy ball.

7.name: Bonespike Helmet
7.description: Bonespike Helmet is a very rare Helmet that when the wearer Rages, all hostile creatures within a 3m radius must roll a wisdom saving throw, if they do not succeed this roll then they take 2-8 psychic damage. They receive half damage upon a successful roll.
7.quote: The tibia of a storm giant was ground and chiselled and reworked till it became this helm. The wearer can actually smell summer tempest clouds like maroon-dark dread while wearing the helm.

7.name: Brimmed Hat
7.description: Brimmed Hat is a common Non-Armour Headwear.
7.quote: This wizardly hat has a little embroidered rabbit inside its lining - the rabbit is called snowball, and once he was lost, never to be found.

7.name: Browbeaten Circlet
7.description: Browbeaten Circlet is an uncommon Helmet that grants the wearer +1 to spell save DC
7.quote: A cornered animal will, on occasion, feel a rush of exhilarating energy, and an urge to fight. The same is true of many arcane practitioners, who do not take kindly to being menaced.

7.name: Cap of Curing
7.description: The Cap of Curing is an uncommon Hat that heals those inspired by the wearer using Bardic Inspiration.
7.quote: Putting on this hat is somehow enough to lift your spirits.

7.name: Cap of Wrath
7.description: The Cap of Wrath is a rare Helmet that grants the wearer Wrath when starts the turn with 50% Hit Points or less.
7.quote: With every blow the skullcap seems to compress, narrowing the vision of the wearer.

7.name: Circle of Bones
7.description: Circle of Bones is a rare Circlet that grants all nearby allied undead Resistance to physical damage, and the wearer can cast Animate Dead once per Long Rest.
7.quote: A coldness clings to this macabre circlet, like the chill of a grave.

7.name: Circlet
7.description: The Circlet is a common Circlet.
7.quote: Provides its wearer a touch of elegance but no additional protection.

7.name: Circlet of Blasting
7.description: The Circlet of Blasting is a rare circlet that grants the wearer the ability to cast the Scorching Ray spell.
7.quote: This delicate circlet grants the wearer the ability to cast the Scorching Ray spell.

7.name: Circlet of Fire
7.description: The Circlet of Fire is an uncommon Circlet that grants the wearer a bonus action whenever they deal Fire damage with a leveled spell.
7.quote: Merely holding the circlet makes your skin flush, filling you with determination and righteous fury.

7.name: Circlet of Hunting
7.description: The Circlet of Hunting is a very rare circlet that grants a +1d4 bonus to Attack Rolls against marked creatures.
7.quote: Huntresses prowling in the least hospitable woods of Toril hold one rule as cardinal: kill quickly. This is not about suffering. It's about sound, and its necessary absence.

7.name: Circlet of Mental Anguish
7.description: The Circlet of Mental Anguish is a rare Circlet that heals the wearer for Healing|1d4 hit points when an enemy fails a Charisma, Intelligence, or Wisdom Saving Throw against one of the wearer's spells or cantrips.
7.quote: Fell magic has seeped into this circlet, rejoicing at the slightest touch of despair.

7.name: Circlet of Psionic Revenge
7.description: The Circlet of Psionic Revenge is a rare Circlet that allows Gith to enhance their saving throws and punish casters with psychic damage.
7.quote: You get the eerie feeling that the jewelsmith used more than alien metals to forge this circlet - something like ancient magic, or shards of a soul.

7.name: Coldbrim Hat
7.description: Coldbrim Hat is an uncommon Hat that, once per turn, causes a condition the wearer inflicts to also inflict 2 turns of Encrusted with Frost.
7.quote: Upturning the hat and gazing into it, you get this slightly vertiginous feeling, as if you were looking into a cold, abandoned well with no discernible end.

7.name: Covert Cowl
7.description: Covert Cowl is an uncommon Helmet that makes the wearer's critical hits more likely when they are obscured.
7.quote: One of the relics of Deep Duerra's rebellious children. Keeping themselves and one another safe from the nasty surprises of their home, the siblings made good progress.  At the final hurdle, they were confronted by none other than Duerra herself, and her rage was great, and they felt the candles of hope in their hearts snuff out.

7.name: Dark Justiciar Helm
7.description: A Dark Justiciar Helm is an uncommon Helmet worn by Shar's Dark Justiciars that grants a bonus to Saving Throws while obscured by shadow.
7.quote: Stamped with Shar's own sigil, this helm was worn by the Nightsinger's own crusaders. The darkness within seems deeper than night, somehow.

7.name: Dark Justiciar Helmet
7.description: The Dark Justiciar Helmet is a very rare Helmet that improves the wearer's Saving Throws against Spells and makes Critical Hits more likely while the wearer is obscured by darkness.
7.quote: Adorned in a fanned coronet of speartip points, its mask fixed with stiff-lipped intent, this helmet evokes a frightful, almost alien aspect that gestures to Shar. For she is strange and terrible indeed.

7.name: Dark Justiciar Mask
7.description: Dark Justiciar Mask is an uncommon Helmet that grants the wearer a bonus to Intimidation checks.
7.quote: Worn by Shar's most loyal zealots, the mere sight of it strikes fear in the heart of even the bravest of souls.

7.name: Devilfoil Mask
7.quote: Beneath a layer of dust, the mask still gleams. An innocent smile and wide, searching eyes - seeking its own kind.

7.name: Diadem of Arcane Synergy
7.description: The Diadem of Arcane Synergy is a rare circlet that grants Arcane Synergy when the wearer inflicts a condition.
7.quote: This circlet shimmers with a hundred otherworldly metals.

7.name: Fierce Golden Helm
7.quote: Aureate twists in the metal give a sheen like polluted sunlight.

7.name: Fistbreaker Helm
7.description: Fistbreaker Helm is an rare Helmet that grants a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and +1 to Initiative Rolls.
7.quote: 'If your foe rains down blows upon your head, turn not the other cheek, but let your pricking helm bleed the bastards dry.'

7.name: Flaming Fist Helmet
7.description: A Flaming Fist Helmet is a common Helmet.
7.quote: The brutish thuggery of the Enforcer's position is summarized in this helmet's design.

7.name: Flawed Helldusk Helmet
7.description: Flawed Helldusk Helmet is a rare Helmet crafted from Infernal Iron that improves the wearer's saving throws against spells.
7.quote: 'When I found Carixim, he turned to me, all those poor people's souls crammed into him like too many bees in a rotten hive, and he... He grinned at me. And he said: I been expecting you, boy.' - Overheard from the smith Dammon

7.name: Frayed Drow Hood
7.description: A Frayed Drow Hood is a common Helmet.
7.quote: A supple leather cowl. Its spiderweb embroidery is stained, and pieces of leather and thread are slowly disintegrating.

7.name: Goldgloss Heraldic Helm
7.quote: Hard as golden dragonscales.

7.name: Grymskull Helm
7.description: The Grymskull Helm is a rare Helmet that sends attackers Reeling when they hit the wearer with a melee attack.
7.quote: Once home to an inscrutable machine intelligence, Grym's skull now serves as a simple helm.

7.name: Haste Helm
7.description: The Haste Helm is a rare helmet that grants the wearer a burst of speed at the start of combat.
7.quote: The helm throbs when violence is near, filling the wearer with a compulsion to act.

7.name: Hat of Fire Acuity
7.description: Hat of Fire Acuity is an uncommon hat that grants the wearer Arcane Acuity Condition Icon|Arcane Acuity (Condition)|Arcane Acuity|size=20  whenever they deal Fire damage.
7.quote: It is said some wizard hats grant the power to keep your head cool - both literally and figuratively.

7.name: Hat of Storm Scion's Power
7.description: Hat of Storm Scion's Power is an uncommon hat that grants Arcane Acuity Condition Icon|Arcane Acuity (Condition)|Arcane Acuity|size=20 for 1 turn whenever the wearer deals Thunder damage.
7.quote: Two sigils glow white where the hat brushes your temples - something is being tapped into; something distant and fearsome.

7.name: Hat of the Sharp Caster
7.description: The Hat of the Sharp Caster is a rare Helmet that rerolls the die(s) on spell attack rolls.
7.quote: All you need now is a holster for your wand, tobacco to chew, and some sort of pack animal to ride, and you'll look like a complete and utter bingus.

7.name: Hat of Uninhibited Kushigo
7.description: The Hat of Uninhibited Kushigo is a rare hat that grants +1 bonus to their Save DC after dealing damage with an unarmed attack.
7.quote: Coming upon a wise woman, Kushigo got drunk and grew maudlin, and told her about Irishi's scalping. She gave him some clothes - light and fine - and encouraged him to take his time to grieve. He did.And, when he was ready, he fought again, uninhibited by steel or fellowship - for they only weighed him down.

7.name: Helldusk Helmet
7.description: Helldusk Helmet is a very rare Helmet that can be obtained from the House of Hope.
7.quote: It is said that Carixim, the fiending titan whose flesh squirms with twenty-thousand trapped souls, forged the pieces of this armour set.

7.name: Helm of Balduran
7.description: Helm of Balduran is a legendary Headwear once worn by the fabled founder of Baldur's Gate, Balduran, and grants hit points every turn along with stun and critical hit immunities.
7.quote: This helm, worn atop the pate of Balduran the Brave, still gleams as if with the untarnished splendour of his legacy. Baldur's Gate itself bears his name, and tales of his exploits have turned the heads and hearts of many.

7.name: Helmet
7.description: A Helmet is a common Helmet.
7.quote: Any padding that once lined this helmet has long since worn away.

7.name: Helmet of Arcane Acuity
7.description: The Helmet of Arcane Acuity is an uncommon Helmet that causes the wearer to gain Arcane Acuity whenever they deal damage with a weapon attack.
7.quote: Subtle magics are woven into the helmet's leather panes - for a powerful offence is sometimes still the best defence.

7.name: Helmet of Autonomy
7.description: The Helmet of Autonomy is an uncommon Helmet that grants the wearer Proficiency in Wisdom Saving Throws.
7.quote: The metal bolted to the helmet's forehead is engraved with a faded script. Though the words have become unintelligible, their magic remains.

7.name: Helmet of Grit
7.description: The Helmet of Grit is a very rare Helmet that grants the wearer an additional Bonus Action at low Hit Points.
7.quote: At the barest touch, you feel a surge of exuberance and stamina - like you could take on anyone and anything.

7.name: Helmet of Smiting
7.description: The Helmet of Smiting is an uncommon Helmet that grants the wearer Temporary Hit Points whenever they apply a Condition using a Smite spell.
7.quote: A set of runes have been expertly worked into the helmet's filigree. Almost imperceptibly - but powerful nonetheless.

7.name: Holy Lance Helm
7.description: A Holy Lance Helm is an uncommon Helmet that potentially deals radiant damage to creatures that attack the wearer.
7.quote: Brief halos of divine light wrap your head when you don and doff this helmet.

7.name: Hood of the Weave
7.description: Hood of the Weave is a very rare Helmet that boosts its wearer's spell-related rolls.
7.quote: Worn by the wizard Tenser when he was inducted into the Circle of Eight.

7.name: Horns of the Berserker
7.description: Horns of the Berserker is a very rare Helmet that grants a +2 bonus to Necrotic damage to melee hits against damaged creatures.
7.quote: This was created by a designer and an enchanter who were going through a messy divorce at the time. As such, the armour is filled with active-aggressive rage. It also makes you feel like you've wasted the last ten years picking up after a complete tit.

7.name: Ignoble Hat
7.description: Ignoble Hat is a common Non-Armour Headwear.
7.quote: Foppish and fluffy and built for just the right sort of dome accustomed to having it set upon the head by other people.

7.name: Jannath's Hat
7.description: Jannath's Hat is a very rare headwear that gives advantage to persuasion and deception checks.
7.quote: The corner of modern fashion that this hat currently occupies might well be called Optimistic.

7.name: Key of the Ancients
7.description: Key of the Ancients is an uncommon Helmet that grants the wearer a bonus to Nature checks.
7.quote: The branches of this circlet are half-fossilised, passed down through generations of druids. Fabricated during the founding of the grove, the wreath is forever linked to its lands, the tiny rubies connected to its stones and structures, bidding them to do their bidding.

7.name: Leather Helmet
7.description: A Leather Helmet is a common Helmet.
7.quote: Layers of leather were boiled and moulded to create this rugged cap. It still smells a bit of tannins.

7.name: Marksmanship Hat
7.description: Marksmanship Hat is an uncommon hat that grants its wearer a bonus to attack rolls.
7.quote: Silvery wings spread over the stiff unyielding leather.

7.name: Mask of Soul Perception
7.description: Mask of Soul Perception is a very rare Helmet that increases a wearer's Attack Rolls, Initiative Rolls, and Perception Checks. The wearer can also cast Detect Thoughts once per Short Rest.
7.quote: Formerly worn by Autumnal Baskin, a professional mediator turned bare-knuckle champion, who gained enlightenment via two methods. The first was giving up her addictive reliance on secluded caves and lonely mountaintops, and getting a bit more sociable. This involved many new skirts. Most of them lavender.

7.name: Mask of the Shapeshifter
7.quote: The magic of this mask comes from its gory provenance and makes it perfect for the discerning actor, sleuth or person with a mirror and time to kill.

7.name: Old Floppy Hat
7.description: Old Floppy Hat is a common Non-Armour Headwear.
7.quote: Whacked around more often than a clown in a tragedy.

7.name: Pyroquickness Hat
7.description: Pyroquickness Hat is a very rare Hat that burns the wearer when casting a fire spell, but also grants them an extra Bonus Action.
7.quote: Merely holding the circlet makes your skin flush, filling you with determination and righteous fury.

7.name: Regal Helm
7.quote: As royal as taxation.

7.name: Rufflesome Blaggart Hat
7.description: Rufflesome Blaggart Hat is a common Non-Armour Headwear.
7.quote: For the discerning ranonteur, spinning of stories, and peacockish personality.

7.name: Sarevok's Horned Helmet
7.description: Sarevok's Horned Helmet is a very rare Headwear that grants Darkvision (Passive Feature)|Darkvision to its wearer, among other bonuses.
7.quote: The last sight Sarevok witnessed as a mortal was his sibling's knife. This duel, the first between Bhaalspawn, is worshipped still by the cult of Bhaal, who now believe that no act is more sacred than fratricide between spawn before the altar of their Dread Lord.

7.name: Scabby Pugilist Circlet
7.description: The Scabby Pugilist Circlet is a rare Helmet that grants additional damage on weapon and unarmed strikes while surrounded by 2 or more foes.
7.quote: Every adventuring party has at least one 'chaotic element'. In the case of one such party, this was the infamous Scabby, a barbarous goblin who was trained by monks.

7.name: Shadow of Menzoberranzan
7.description: The Shadow of Menzoberranzan is an rare Helmet that allows the wearer to become Invisible.
7.quote: You sense the shadows that envelop this drowcraft cowl, eagerly awaiting to envelop you and shield you from view.

7.name: Steelwatcher Helmet
7.description: Steelwatcher Helmet is a rare Helmet that grants the wearer the wearer Darkvision and immunity to Blindness. It also grants Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws.
7.quote: 'When I found Carixim, he turned to me, all those poor people's souls crammed into him like too many bees in a rotten hive, and he... He grinned at me. And he said: I been expecting you, boy.' - Overheard from the smith Dammon

7.name: The Lifebringer
7.description: The Lifebringer is an uncommon circlet that grants the wearer temporary hit points whenever they gain Lightning Charges.
7.quote: 'Lightning is like magic,' Yrre the Sparkstruck once said. 'And what is magic but life itself?'

7.name: The Pointy Hat
7.description: The Pointy Hat is a rare hat that gives the wearer a bonus to their persuasion checks.
7.quote: Sages over the course of ages have dealt very constructive and useful advice - however, none so sagacious as that of the wizard Otiluke, who once advised one of his students thusly: 'Never cast Speak with Dead on a loved one if there's unresolved tension there. It's never worth it. Trust me.'

7.name: The Shadespell Circlet
7.description: The Shadespell Circlet is an uncommon Helmet that grants a bonus Spell Save DC when the wearer is obscured in shadow.
7.quote: One of the relics of Deep Duerra's rebellious children. Flanked by her court, Duerra shook her head at her children. Had they really believed they could leave her?

7.name: Triumphal Helm
7.quote: Worn ceremonially by commanders and general at the head of parades.

7.name: Wapira's Crown
7.description: Wapira's Crown is an uncommon Helmet that heals the wearer whenever they heal another creature.
7.quote: Legends say a Giant Elk and a druid once formed a powerful friendship. When the Elk laid down his life for the druid, she crafted this helmet in honour of her beloved friend, so his beauty and compassion would live on forever.

7.name: Warped Headband of Intellect
7.description: The Warped Headband of Intellect is an uncommon Circlet that raises the wearer's Intelligence.
7.quote: This particular circlet is covered in yellow slime and has pieces of half-digested mutton stuck behind the gems.

7.name: Whispering Mask
7.description: Whispering Mask is a common Helmet with connections to Auntie Ethel. SpoilerWarning
7.quote: Soft, unintelligible whispers seep from the dark wood, ringing in your ears and resounding in your skull.

8.name: Leather Armour
8.description: Leather Armour is a common Light Armour.
8.quote: Dark, messy stains line the armholes of the well-used leather breastplate.

8.name: Armour of Landfall
8.description: Armour of Landfall is a very rare Light Armour that improves the spellcasting ability of its wearer and also gives various plant based powers.
8.quote: Smelling of long-abandoned gardens grown wild with thorny roses, moss and hibiscus, this armour was worn by a powerful druid who spent so long from people that she forgot to miss them.

8.name: Armour of Moonbasking
8.description: Armour of Moonbasking is a very rare Light Armour bought from Voiceless Penitent Bareki that bestows Temporary Hit Points and Armour Class to its wielder when they Wild Shape.
8.quote: This armour was designed by lunar-obsessed Cuthbertina, a gnomish arcane smith who now lives peacefully on a mountain plateau with her magical forge.

8.name: Armour of the Sporekeeper
8.description: Armour of the Sporekeeper is a very rare Light Armour that enhances the wearer's Necrotic|Necrotic damage and Symbiotic Entity ability.
8.quote: According to one story, this armour was enriched by the cascading spores of a myconid sovereign, its great fungal head shimmering and twinkling as it shook upon the material.

8.name: Bhaalist Armour
8.description: Bhaalist Armour is a very rare Light Armour that grants an Aura of Murder and a bonus to Initiative rolls.
8.quote: Bhaal, Lord of Murder, was forced to walk the world as a mortal man during a period of history called the Time of Troubles. He was more vulnerable than he had ever been. But Bhaal was cunning. He had contingencies in case he died.

8.name: Blazer of Benevolence
8.description: The Blazer of Benevolence is an uncommon Light Armour that grants the wearer Temporary Hit Points when they inspire an ally with Bardic Inspiration.
8.quote: Even though the embroidered velvet won't help against a sharp blade, wearing it fills you with self-assuredness.

8.name: Broken Padded Armour
8.description: Broken Padded Armour is a common Light Armour.
8.quote: A standard gambeson of quilted cloth. Good for catching blows, but almost unbearably sweaty.

8.name: Drow Studded Leather Armour
8.description: Drow Studded Leather Armour is an rare Light Armour that aids the wearer with Stealth checks.
8.quote: Tracings of glossy black spider-web mark this drown-made armour. Its supple, but strong - and made to blend in with the dark caves and crevices of the Underdark.

8.name: Druid Leather Armour
8.description: Druid Leather Armour is a common Light Armour.
8.quote: Dark, messy stains line the armholes of the well-used leather breastplate.

8.name: Elegant Studded Leather
8.description: Elegant Studded Leather is a very rare Light Armour that provides bonuses to initiative, stealth, and grants access to Spell Shield|Shield|size=25.
8.quote: After she returned from her confinement at the hands of the demon prince Graz'zt, the Goddess of prosperity, Waukeen, appointed a champion, who donned this studded leather and took up arms against those who had schismed and corrupted her church in the interim.

8.name: Faded Drow Leather Armour
8.description: Faded Drow Leather Armour is a common Light Armour.
8.quote: The sun's harsh light has dulled this armour's dark lustre.

8.name: Leather Armour +1
8.description: Leather Armour +1 is an uncommon Light Armour.
8.quote: This well-tailored leather tunic is reinforced by geometric quilting.

8.name: Leather Armour +2
8.description: Leather Armour +2 is an uncommon Light Armour.
8.quote: This armour is stitched together with thick, metal-lined cord, reinforcing it at the seams.

8.name: Padded Armour
8.description: Padded Armour is a common Light Armour.
8.quote: A standard gambeson of quilted cloth. Good for catching blows, but almost unbearably sweaty.

8.name: Padded Armour (Astarion)
8.description: Padded Armour (Astarion) is a common Light Armour and an alternate appearance of Padded Armour unique to Astarion.
8.quote: Despite the careful stitches, the gold embroidery on this padded doublet is slowly unraveling.

8.name: Padded Armour (Warlock)
8.description: Padded Armour is a common Light Armour.
8.quote: A standard gambeson of quilted cloth. Good for catching blows, but almost unbearably sweaty.

8.name: Padded Armour +1
8.description: Padded Armour +1 is a uncommon Light Armour.
8.quote: The quilting threads running through this padded vest seem to gleam in the rising sun.

8.name: Padded Armour +2
8.description: Padded Armour +2 is a rare Light Armour.
8.quote: A standard gambeson of quilted cloth. Good for catching blows, but almost unbearably sweaty.

8.name: Penumbral Armour
8.description: Penumbral Armour is a rare Light Armour that enhances Stealth when the wearer is Obscured.
8.quote: One of the Relics of Deep Duerra's rebellious children. Kitted out though they were for escape, the older siblings had a horrible time encouraging their younger brothers and sisters, who at the crux were frightened of what their mother would do to them should they be caught.

8.name: Scarlet Leather Armour
8.description: Scarlet Leather Armour is an uncommon Light Armour that grants its wearer +1 to Stealth checks.
8.quote: This well-tailored leather tunic is reinforced by geometric quilting.

8.name: Selûnite Robe
8.description: Selunite Robe is a common yet unique Light Armour.
8.quote: Crafted with care, this robe will protect you from the elements. It won't do much against a sword's thrust, though.

8.name: Shadeclinger Armour
8.description: Shadeclinger Armour is a rare Light Armour.
8.quote: Glutted with lone wolves and well-meaning scallywags, the Harpers are not averse to shadows - quite the contrary. For many such individuals, being swallow in the dark throat of the night is the only method they know or care to know.

8.name: Simple Jerkin
8.description: Simple Jerkin is a common Light Armour.
8.quote: Dark, messy stains line the armholes of the well-used leather breastplate.

8.name: Spidersilk Armour
8.description: Spidersilk Armour is a rare Light Armour that aids the wearer with Stealth checks and Constitution Saving Throws.
8.quote: Tracings of glossy black spider-web mark this drow-made armour. It is supple, but strong - and made to blend in with the dark caves and crevices of the Underdark.

8.name: Studded Leather Armour
8.description: Studded Leather Armour is a common Light Armour.
8.quote: Shaped, hardened, and reinforced with metal studs, leather is the armour of choice for those who value agility as much as protection.

8.name: Studded Leather Armour +1
8.description: Studded Leather Armour +1 is an uncommon Light Armour.
8.quote: This armour is strong enough to stop a dagger and light enough to escape whatever weapon follows it.

8.name: Studded Leather Armour +2
8.description: Studded Leather Armour +2 is a rare Light Armour.
8.quote: Superbly shaped, elegantly designed, and tough as ring mail with none of the weight.

9.name: Adamantine Scale Mail
9.description: Adamantine Scale Mail is a very rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: The adamantine scales hug your body like a second skin - a heavy, near-impregnable skin.

9.name: Armour of Agility
9.description: The Armour of Agility is a very rare Medium Armour that doesn't limit your AC's Dexterity bonus.
9.quote: Layered sheets of smelted, shaped, and smithed steel have been etched with a sweetly luminous gold. Its outward appearance is heavy. And yet it's so light when you lift it, like lifting a bag of shrunken dead leaves.

9.name: Barkskin Armour
9.description: Barkskin Armour is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: The bark motifs in this armour are like the boles of oak trees in a wood where the acorns slept long and grew proud.

9.name: Breastplate
9.description: Breastplate is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: This standard-sized breastplate is lined with thick padding meant to cushion the wearer and deflect blows from assailants. The uniform squares of the padding suggest a mathematically-mind crafter.

9.name: Breastplate +1
9.description: Breastplate +1 is an uncommon Medium Armour.
9.quote: This breastplate is crafted in the specialty style of a mysterious armourer in Amn known only as 'The Tailor.'

9.name: Breastplate +2
9.description: Breastplate +2 is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: This garment's previous owner left a few minor personal effects in its inner breast pocket: a scrap of sassafrass, a short bit of thread, and half a peppermint.

9.name: Chain of Liberation
9.description: The Chain of Liberation is an uncommon Medium Armour that allows the wearer to sacrifice their Momentum to rush forward and avoid Attacks of Opportunity.
9.quote: Linked rings crackle with energy, just waiting to be released.

9.name: Chain Shirt
9.description: A Chain Shirt is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: Tight chains protect the wearer from many sharp weapons, while fabric padding protects the skin from cold metal.

9.name: Chain Shirt (Shadowheart)
9.description: Chain Shirt (Shadowheart) is a common Medium Armour and an alternate appearance of Chain Shirt unique to Shadowheart
9.quote: While the stitching on the shirt is rushed and uneven, the chain mail is sturdy, and the garment is decorated with an obsidian disk that seems to swallow all light.

9.name: Chain Shirt +1
9.description: Chain Shirt +1 is an uncommon Medium Armour
9.quote: The intricate embroidery on the linen panel of this armour indicates the nobility of its previous owner.

9.name: Chain Shirt +2
9.description: Chain Shirt +2 is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: This mail's impossibly fine, close joining indicates the work of gnomish fingers.

9.name: Damaged Dark Justiciar Armour
9.description: A Medium Armour that is the degraded version of Dark Justiciar Mail.

9.name: Dark Justiciar Half-Plate (Rare)
9.description: Dark Justiciar Half-Plate is a rare Medium Armour that grants Advantage on Stealth checks while Obscured in shadow. It also grants Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws and allows its wearer to cast Shield of Faith once per Long Rest.
9.quote: Shar's aspect winds its way though the patterns and pauldrons of this half plate, and any light cast nearby seems to almost quiver away from it, afraid. For even the light knows that the clank of this armour is swiftly followed by the Dark Justiciar's silent blade.

9.name: Dark Justiciar Half-Plate (Very Rare)
9.description: Dark Justiciar Half-Plate is a very rare Medium Armour that grants Advantage on Stealth checks while Obscured in shadow. It also grants Advantage on Constitution Saving Throws, allows its wearer to cast Shield of Faith once per Long Rest, and reduces damage while Shield of Faith is active on its wearer.
9.quote: Shar's aspect winds its way though the patterns and pauldrons of this half plate, and any light cast nearby seems to almost quiver away from it, afraid. For even the light knows that the clank of this armour is swiftly followed by the Dark Justiciar's silent blade.

9.name: Dark Justiciar Mail
9.description: Dark Justiciar Mail is an uncommon Medium Armour that deals Necrotic damage to creatures that hit the wearer with a melee attack while the wearer is Obscured by shadow.
9.quote: Though well-preserved, the armour's gleam is somewhat muted - as if half-shadowed, even in brightest day.

9.name: Elven Chain
9.description: Elven Chain is a rare Medium Armour that grants its wearer bonuses to Initiative Rolls and Dexterity Saving Throws.
9.quote: The weight of the interwoven steel rings is offset by clever elven craftsmanship - rustling against your undershirt, the mail feels like you're wearing a cloud.

9.name: Flame Enamelled Armour
9.description: Flame Enamelled Armour is a very rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: The air around this armour shimmers, oven-hot. From the seams of the armour you can hear a red-tinted rumble, like coals digesting in a furnace.

9.name: Githyanki Half Plate
9.description: Githyanki Half Plate is a common Medium Armour worn by the Githyanki.
9.quote: This armour was forged to Vlaakith's standards under the exacting eye of a githyanki smith.

9.name: Half Plate Armour
9.description: Half Plate Armour is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: This heavy, resilient breastplate is reinforced by a padded gamberson to protect soldiers from hip to neck.

9.name: Half Plate Armour +1
9.description: Half Plate Armour +1 is a uncommon Medium Armour.
9.quote: Heraldic runes are sewn into the padding of this armour, offering a gift of protection to whoever dons it.

9.name: Half Plate Armour +2
9.description: Half Plate Armour +2 is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: This breastplate is far tougher than it appears, taking blows from common weapons without suffering so much as a scratch.

9.name: Hedge Wanderer Armour
9.description: The Hedge Wanderer Armour is an uncommon Medium Armour that provides a small boost to Skill Checks.
9.quote: This simple cured goat hide was enchanted by a travelling druid. A goatherd once helped her negotiate a strange maze of hedges, so she blessed all his goats in thanks.

9.name: Hide Armour
9.description: Hide Armour is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: Constructed from carefully-chosen animal hides tanned, hardened and varnished to a gleaming finish.

9.name: Hide Armour +1
9.description: Hide Armour +1 is a uncommon Medium Armour.
9.quote: Tight stitches bind panels of hard leather into a formfitting carapace that moves like a second skin.

9.name: Hide Armour +2
9.description: Hide Armour +2 is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: This hide armour, soft to the touch but hard as a zaratan's hide, is stitched together of narrow panels allowing for the wearer's ease of movement and comfort.

9.name: Luminous Armour
9.description: Luminous Armour is an uncommon Medium Armour that allows the wearer to cause radiant shockwaves.
9.quote: Many an adventurer has found themselves swallowed up by the dark throat of some nameless dungeon, aching for a glimpse of light.

9.name: Psionic Ward Armour
9.description: Psionic Ward Armour is a set of rare Medium Armour that gives the wearer Resistance to Psychic damage.
9.quote: After all that was done to them at the illithids' caprice, it is little wonder that the gith would construct armaments fit for combating the psionic might

9.name: Robust Chain Shirt
9.description: The Robust Chain Shirt is an uncommon Medium Armour that deals Piercing|Piercing damage to enemies that damage the wearer with a melee attack while the wearer is greatly injured.
9.quote: A multitude of names is embroidered on the inside collar - the lives of those this shirt has saved.

9.name: Scale Mail
9.description: Scale Mail is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: A hefty shirt of scale, offering some protection against the slings and arrows of the world.

9.name: Scale Mail +1
9.description: Scale Mail +1 is a uncommon Medium Armour.
9.quote: The work of a skilled craftsman, this scale shirt offers better protection than most.

9.name: Scale Mail +2
9.description: Scale Mail +2 is a rare Medium Armour.
9.quote: Crafted by an artist's hands, this exquisite scale shirt feels like it could turn aside any blade.

9.name: Scale Mail Armour +1
9.description: Scale Mail +1 is an uncommon Medium Armour.
9.quote: The work of a skilled craftsman, this scale shirt offers better protection than most.

9.name: Scale Mail of Devotion
9.description: The Scale Mail of Devotion is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: Embroidered on the tabard are the tenets of devotion: Honesty, Courage, Compassion, Honour, and Duty.

9.name: Scale Mail of the Ancients
9.description: The Scale Mail of the Ancients is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: Four embroidered sentences decorate the tabard - the tenets of the ancients: 'Kindle the Light. Shelter the Light. Preserve your own Light. Be the Light.'

9.name: Scale Mail of Vengeance
9.description: The Scale Mail of Vengeance is a common Medium Armour.
9.quote: Gold embroidery covers the inside of the tabard, right over the heart: 'By any means necessary, I will fight the Greater Evil, showing no mercy for the wicked.'

9.name: Sharpened Snare Cuirass
9.description: Sharpened Snare Cuirass is a very rare Medium Armour that adds your Dexterity Modifier to your ArmourClass.
9.quote: This magnificent hide was harvested from a rare mythological creature of the Feywild, a cross bettween a unicorn and a stoat.

9.name: Slippery Chain Shirt
9.description: The Slippery Chain Shirt is an uncommon Medium Armour that allows creatures the wearer heals to move without provoking Opportunity Attacks.
9.quote: Scored with slime and blood, it seems this chain mail shirt couldn't save its previous owner. Although it may help the next.

9.name: The Jolty Vest
9.description: The Jolty Vest is a rare Medium Armour that shocks enemies who land attacks on the wearer while they have Lightning Charges.
9.quote: Yrre the Sparkstruck got their nickname for both their obsession with lightning and the inventions they created, which had the habit of electrocuting both Yrre and any poor observers that got too close.

9.name: The Oakfather's Embrace
9.description: The Oakfather's Embrace is an uncommon Medium Armour that deals Radiant|Radiant damage to creatures violating the natural order, including the wearer.
9.quote: Embroidered with a simple maxim - 'Nature is the True State of the World' - these hides radiate a faint divine power.

9.name: Unwanted Masterwork Scalemail
9.description: The Unwanted Masterwork Scalemail is a rare Medium Armour that doesn't limit your AC's Dexterity bonus. It is part of the Unwanted set.
9.quote: Nothing stings the master blacksmith more than a cancelled commission - not even molten iron. This mail is engraved with the mark of a devillish forgemaster, as well as several curses stamped out in infernal, and hums with diabolic magic.

9.name: Yuan-Ti Scale Mail
9.description: Yuan-Ti Scale Mail is a rare Medium Armour that adds the wearer's Dexterity Modifier to their Armour Class.
9.quote: The Snakefolk of Chult are not known for waste, so often forge lightweight and robust armour like this from their own shed skin.

10.name: 'Magic' Ring
10.description: 'Magic' Ring is a common Ring which can be sold or bartered with.
10.quote: The runes encircling this ring appear to have been scratched into the metal with a rock.

10.name: After Death Do Us Part
10.description: After Death Do Us Part is a rare Ring that allows its wearer to regain half their hit points after being Downed, but be cursed with Shadow Possession.
10.quote: Love is the last cruel leaf to fall in an autumn wide with sorrow.

10.name: Amethyst Ring
10.description: An Amethyst Ring is a common type of Ring. Primarily of use for bartering or sale to Traders.
10.quote: An unusual piece, this gold-studded amethyst caused a stir at the Wide plaza in Baldur's Gate

10.name: Band of the Mystic Scoundrel
10.description: Band of the Mystic Scoundrel is a rare Ring that grants the wearer the ability to cast illusion or enchantment spells as a bonus action after hitting a creature with a weapon attack.
10.quote: What better way to disguise one's transgressions than a quickly positioned phantasm after the deed is done?

10.name: Bracing Band
10.description: The Bracing Band is an uncommon Ring that makes the wearer more difficult to hit after they shove an enemy.
10.quote: A common ring, simple and unadorned. Though there is a certain heft to it...

10.name: Bronze Ring
10.description: A Bronze Ring describes a variety of common Ring, primarily of value for use in trading or bartering with vendors.
10.quote: A purple gemstone set in bronze, this ring has been crafted by a steady and practised hand.

10.name: Burnished Ring
10.description: The Burnished Ring is a very rare Ring that allows the wearer to cast Paralyzing Ray once per Long Rest.
10.quote: A paralysing eyestalk harvested from a beholder was boiled in a broth, and poured down the throat of a dwarven ringsmith. Not one fortnight thence, he crafted this ring.

10.name: Callous Glow Ring
10.description: Callous Glow Ring is an uncommon Ring that causes the wearer to deal an additional Radiant|2 Radiant damage to illuminated creatures every time they deal damage.
10.quote: A grudging gleam emits from this ring - more an indictment of light than an endorsement.

10.name: Carnelian Ring
10.description: An Carnelian Ring is a common Ring. Primarily of use for bartering or sale to Traders.
10.quote: Considered a token of good fortune, this ring's stones are perfectly smooth.

10.name: Caustic Band
10.description: Caustic Band is an uncommon Ring that grants the wearer Acid|2 Acid damage with weapon attacks.
10.quote: Adjusting this unassuming ring on your finger, you hear a faint sizzle, as of pressure being released.

10.name: Copper Band
10.description: A Copper Band is a common type of Ring. Primarily of use for bartering or sale to Traders.
10.quote: This chunky copper ring is embedded with dark green stones.

10.name: Coruscation Ring
10.description: Coruscation Ring is an uncommon Ring that inflicts Radiating Orb on creatures that the wearer deals spell damage to. The wearer must be illuminated for this effect to occur.
10.quote: Provocative light blooms from the engraved contours of this ring.

10.name: Crusher's Ring
10.description: Crusher's Ring is an uncommon Ring that grants additional speed to the wearer.
10.quote: Though caked with mud and grime, the ring smells faintly of lavender. Remarkable, considering where it's been.

10.name: Crypt Lord Ring
10.description: Crypt Lord Ring is a very rare Ring that allows the wearer to cast Create Undead once per Long Rest.
10.quote: Slipping one's finger through this ring fills the senses with the waft of tombs, the urine-yellow smell of old bandages, images of dead spiders curled into husks, and the sensation of hot, slobbering breath at the nape of one's neck.

10.name: Dark Ring
10.description: A Dark Ring is a common type of Ring. Primarily of use for bartering or sale to Traders.
10.quote: With a sharpened gemstone at its centre, this ring is capable of cutting the very flesh it decorates.

10.name: Djinni Ring
10.description: Djinni Ring is an uncommon Ring that grants its wearer the ability to cast Mage Hand.
10.quote: The ring from the djinni who worked in the circus. Its magic certainly explains how the djinni was able to cheat at the wheel.

10.name: Dowry Ring
10.description: A Dowry Ring is a common type of Ring. It can be sold or bartered with, but it is better used to complete a related Quest.
10.quote: A simple gold ring with a simple inscription: 'From Miri and Benryn'.

10.name: Emerald Ring
10.description: An Emerald Ring is a common type of Ring. Primarily of use for barter or sale to Traders.
10.quote: Imported in bulk from Calimshan, the gemstone set in this ring is roughly finished and marred with visible flaws.

10.name: Eversight Ring
10.description: Eversight Ring is an uncommon Ring that gives the wearer Immunity to Blinded|Blinded.

10.name: Explorer's Ring
10.description: The Explorer's Ring is an uncommon Ring that improves the wearer's knowledge of Nature and Survival.
10.quote: A radiant and remarkably preserved ring, forged from arandur metal.

10.name: Family Ring
10.description: The Family Ring is an uncommon Ring that grants Death SavingThrow +2.

10.name: Fetish of Callarduran Smoothhands
10.description: The Fetish of Callarduran Smoothhands is a rare Ring that allows the wearer to cast the Invisibility spell once per Long Rest.
10.quote: The smooth, six-pointed star on this ring is beset with small Underdark gemstones, as befits a talisman of the god of mining and patron of deep gnomes.

10.name: Firzu's Ring of Trading
10.description: Firzu's Ring of Trading is an uncommon Ring that grants +1 to Deception.
10.quote: Belonged to a trader Firzu. Increases Deception Checks by 1.

10.name: Garnet Ring
10.description: A Garnet Ring is a common type of Ring. Primarily of use for barter or sale to Traders.
10.quote: The garnet at the centerpiece of this ring is like an unblinking, malevolent eye.

10.name: Gold Band
10.description: A Gold Band is a common type of Ring. Primarily of use for bartering or sale to Traders.
